description: ConsulSDConfig defines a Consul service discovery configuration. See [here](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/victoriametrics/sd_configs/#consul_sd_configs)

allowStale.description: Allow stale Consul results (see https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/api-docs/features/consistency ). Will reduce load on Consul. If unset, use its default value.

authorization.description: Authorization header to use on every scrape request.

basicAuth.description: BasicAuth information to use on every scrape request.

datacenter.description: Consul Datacenter name, if not provided it will use the local Consul Agent Datacenter.

filter.description: Filter defines filter for /v1/catalog/services requests See https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/api-docs/features/filtering

followRedirects.description: Configure whether HTTP requests follow HTTP 3xx redirects. If unset, use its default value.

namespace.description: Namespaces are only supported in Consul Enterprise.

nodeMeta.description: Node metadata key/value pairs to filter nodes for a given service.

partition.description: Admin Partitions are only supported in Consul Enterprise.

proxyURL.description: ProxyURL eg http://proxyserver:2195 Directs scrapes to proxy through this endpoint.

proxy_client_config.description: ProxyClientConfig configures proxy auth settings for scraping See [feature description](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/victoriametrics/vmagent/#scraping-targets-via-a-proxy)

server.description: A valid string consisting of a hostname or IP followed by an optional port number.

services.description: A list of services for which targets are retrieved. If omitted, all services are scraped.

tagSeparator.description: The string by which Consul tags are joined into the tag label. If unset, use its default value.

tags.description: An optional list of tags used to filter nodes for a given service. Services must contain all tags in the list.

tlsConfig.description: TLS configuration to use on every scrape request

tokenRef.description: Consul ACL TokenRef, if not provided it will use the ACL from the local Consul Agent.
